title: Marco Verratti reveals how close he came to leaving PSG for Spanish giants Barcelona in 2016
text:
Paris Saint-Germain midfielder Marco Verratti reveals he 'considered' a switch to Barcelona in the summer of 2016.

The Italy international has been a cornerstone of PSG's ambitious project since joining the club from hometown side Pescara in 2012.

But Verratti has disclosed that Barcelona did indeed make him an offer in 2016, following Xavi's departure and with Andres Iniesta's time coming to a gradual end, and even offered him more money.

Marco Verratti has been a key cog in the Paris Saint-Germain machine since his arrival in 2012

Verratti had been earmarked as a potential long-term replacement for Barcelona's Xavi

MARCO VERRATTI AT PSG Appearances: 288 Goals: 9 Assists: 47 Yellow cards: 85 Red cards: 5 Statistics according to Transfermarkt

Speaking to French outlets L'Equipe and RMC Sport, Verratti said: 'Barcelona presented me with something else, it is normal that at one time you think.'

It is believed PSG were offered around £86million by Barcelona for Verratti's signature, and the Italian himself would have received a lucrative contract.

Whilst admitting he was tempted by a move to the Camp Nou, the 26-year-old explained he was invested in the PSG project.

In a previous interview with L'Equipe in 2017, Verratti said: 'I'm honest, for the first time in five years I wondered if I should stay here.

'People think that I play for PSG for the money, but I could get that elsewhere, too. If I had moved in the summer, there were clubs ready to pay €100m to sign me and I would have earned a lot more.

The 26-year-old tenacious midfielder has not been able to lead PSG to European glory yet

'Neymar, he could have earned as much with Manchester City or Chelsea. He didn't sign here for the money but the project. It's the same with me.'

As it happens, Barcelona decided to buy Andre Gomes from Valencia - who is now at Everton - and Denis Suarez from Villarreal.

Verratti has gone on to make 288 appearances for PSG, in a seven-year stint which has brought six Ligue 1 titles, four French Cups but a disappointing best-showing of the quarter-finals in the Champions League.
